content: REQUIRED NOTIFICATION OF SECTION 527 STATUS. Section 527 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to require organizations to notify the Secretary electronically and in writing within 24 hours of establishment to be treated as Section 527 organizations. Failure to provide timely notice will result in the organization not being treated as such. The notice required for Section 527 organizations includes organization details such as name, address, purpose, officers, Board of Directors, related entities, and other information as required by the Secretary. Failure to meet these requirements will result in the organization not being treated as a Section 527 organization. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to include disclosure requirements for organizations under section 527(j), allowing public access to reports filed by these organizations. Organizations with gross receipts of $25,000 or more are required to file returns, and political organizations must file a return under section 6012(a)(6).
